We went for the first time for their lunch special. I go the the stores next door often and always smell something good coming from this place. 

There were only a few people in the restaurant as it had just opened. We were seated right away and our server was very friendly and polite. 

We got the lunch special that was actually a really good deal! This place doesn't do AYCE and most of the places we go to do. The special included 3 pieces of sashimi (chef's choice) 3 piece nigiri, and a roll for around $15. The quality of the sushi was excellent. Everything tasted fresh. I can't remember the name of the roll I got, but it had a mango salsa on top. It paired really well!

I want to come back to this place for more sushi and to try the hibachi! Definitely recommend it!

It's so funny, that I couldn't remember eating here! It took me a bit to remember which is sad because I did enjoy the meal!
I came here with friends, Erika T and Aileen, after a day of shopping at Primm.
I ordered the tako (octopus) and it was delicious. The lobster roll tasted nice but it fell apart. (I think it was too drowned in sauce). The salad was ok, I prefer a ginger dressing that tastes like ginger.
The service was good, the prices are good too. I'll come back for sure, if I am in the area. It's alittle far from where I live for me to be a regular.
We came here for the hibachi for our 6th wedding anniversary, and had a great time! Fun, friendly, good food, and entertaining. Friendly staff and fun filled atmosphere. We will be coming back again!

My husband and I have been coming here for years now. We absolutely love Ohjahs!! The food and service is always amazing. 

Do yourself a big favor - skip Benihanas and go to Ohjah!

For the best experience sit at the sushi bar and get to know the chefs.  They offer great sushi rolls with many to choose from.  The sushi boat is a great value and comes with so much stuff.  Staff is friendly and it's always clean.   The boba tea is very good here too.  Awesome uni when it's available.

Service: Outstanding! Everyone in the restaurant wore a smile and had a great positive attitude! I give 5 STARs just on the service.

Appetizer:  Fried Oysters.  I am from Eastern NC, so I typically like my fried oysters in a light batter.  The fried oysters batter was very thick and greasy.  It was also served with BBQ sauce.  

Dinner: The salad dressing that they serve is different.  It's almost like a mayo based ginger salad dressing.  It was not my favorite. I like that the portions are not HUGE, so you could actually finish it.  I like that the chef was VERY accommodating of how I wanted my food to be cooked.  He was very happy to cook my food separately.
The service was good... the food was fresh and tasty. I had sushi not teppanyaki so I can't review on that. Nothing memorable but it's pretty close to my house so I will be going again.

The prices might be deceiving but it's all worth it! The hibachi was awesome! I recommend getting the hibachi combination it comes with, salad, onion soup, rice or noodles, and 3 entrees for only $30! As an awesome bonus the chefs put on a show for you while they cook! This place is defiantly worth a visit.
Not impressed with this place.  Chicken is way over cooked, wait staff doesn't know the menu, and the prices seem a bit hi for the quality..  Not a fan at all..

I love this place. It is fairly new and serve sushi and hibachi mostly. I have been there for both lunch and dinner (hibachi and regular dining) with my husband. The garlic edamame sets this place apart for me. The food is fresh and tasty. The hibachi chefs are fun and entertaining. The servers are pretty good, but have had just a couple issues. Ordered an appetizer once and it never came. When I mentioned to the waiter to just cancel it because our food was just showing up, the appetizer then came. They ended up comp'ing it because of the mix up and I quickly forgave them. Great, clean atmosphere. Other dishes available for those who do not like sushi as well. I highly recommend it for the cautious and daring alike.

I usually go there have sushi.
I went there to have late lunch with my friend.
We had ohjah boat with my favorite rolls(dark cycle, cowboy, gentlemen's club).
Very good price, 3 rolls were very tasty and sashimi was fresh. Service is always good.
I always go there to have sushi. Haven't tried hibachi yet... Hibachi area is always busy. I will try hibachi next time for sure.

I have been here twice already, and it was okay.  Not sure if I would drive to that side of town again to go there.  We saw this place when we would eat at Cafe Rio which was across the street.  

The servers were nice.  The menu had a lot of selections.  They also served Chinese and Thai food.  Both times I have been there it was for sushi and not the hibachi, so I can't speak for that.  Thinking back, I can't even remember the name of the roll I tried and remembered if it was good.  Which goes to show it was probably just alright.  The restaurant is nice; and it is dark inside.

The funny thing, I do remember is that every time they brought out a dessert for a guest's birthday, the old school 'happy birthday' song (kids singing) would go on their sound system, haha

We went to dinner here last night with our two small children, ages 3 and 5, and were pleasantly surprised. They treated the children great, and they loved the little chopstick holder that made it possible for them to eat with. The food was great and very reasonable. The only complaint is their onion soup is so-so, but all the other food and service made up for that. We will back very soon

My 3.5 year old daughter loves to eat here.  We have only done the cooking tables and each time we go she has a better time then before.  At first the tricks scared her - but now she totally gets into it.  Typically she doesn't each much, but here she eats everything we put in front of her.  One day maybe we will get to the other menu items - but it is too much fun to watch her interact with the cooking table chefs and even more fun to watch her clean her plate.
Cook is awesome so is the food however the waiter was a joke!!! I am a regular every 3 weeks but after that customers service I will no lo get be a regular amazing! !

Came here w my family and had hibachi. We were seated promptly and everyone was friendly. The menu had lots of choices for sushi and hibachi. They even surprised my mom with a happy birthday dessert. It was great food, great service, & a great time.  It was nice that we could go somewhere as a family.  My brother has a 4 year old son and things can get loud as we all talk with him & play with him.

Ohjah gets 5 stars for the accommodations, friendliness, clean restaurant, professionalism of the staff, quality of food, & prices.

We were seated promptly but we did arrive at 6:00pm. When we left at 7:00-7:30, there was a wait and small crowd at the door.

Fast and friendly service.  
Our first meal in Vegas! Woohoooo!! 
Waiting for our food nomnom. I'll update what the food taste

We decided to give this place another chance after a not so pleasant experience with one of the chefs last time. The owner was very understanding and set up a reservation for us to come back. We came for a late lunch around 3:30pm before the rush. The manager greeted and sat us on the hibachi side and the staff was very accommodating. We had Keith as our chef (aka "Hello Keithy" he said, which was pretty catchy) and he remembered us from a previous time. He's always very nice, friendly, and in a happy mood which is always a good sign. I do think that the staff's mood is a big part of setting a guest's experience. He was able to add extra garlic to my meal without acting like it was a hassle (which the previous chef was not happy about when I asked last time). My friend and I both had the shrimp and NY steak and it was very flavorful and well prepared. Next time I come in I'll definitely request Keith again.

Great experience! A friend of mine came in town for the holidays and we found this spot on Yelp. The restaurant was clean, comfortably tempered, and well lit. The front dining area has tables, as well as seating along the bar. We sat in the side room at the hibachi grill. 

The food was great..I ordered the shrimp & chicken hibachi with fried noodles. My friend ordered shrimp and filet mignon with fried rice..everything was cooked to perfection. The hibachi chef, waitress, and bartender were all friendly and accommodating. 

I only gave 4 stars because the price to have Seabass as an add on in your habachi was higher than I would have expected. I would absolutely go back and recommend to others.

Fantastic hibachi! You have to order the basic first - which comes with onion soup, salad, and your choice of fried rice, steamed rice or noodles. That in itself runs about $8.95. Next you add on your choice of meat, fish, shrimp, scallops or lobster - these prices vary from $4.95 - $49. I ordered the teriyaki steak and it was phenomenal! My friend ordered the New York steak and he thought it was amazing as well. We also ordered saki with our meal, 2 large Saporo's and for dessert mango mochi. It was a ton of food and drinks, and I think we spent about $80 with tip for the chef and waiter. Our chef was funny and entertaining. Great experience and we will definitely be going back! Next time I will try the sushi and review.
You won't be disappointed here...good food and great service.  Friendly atmosphere with fair prices. We'll be back and will recommend them to others...thanks!
Amazing food, amazing service.... You can't go wrong with hibachi. Bar only has beer, wine and Japanese drinks.

I love this place! It's right next to my house! I brought so many friends and family over here! I order rolls to go almost every week! Stuff is always nice and happy to see you:) I recommend to check it out! It's good for 2 or big party!!!!

I think this could be the best bargain for quality hibachi food there is in Vegas! The staff is friendly and fun loving, the food is outstanding, the portions are great, and it is overall my favorite place for this type of dining!

Picture this - Sea World and the dolphins are doing funny things to the sound of a whistle. Now flash forward to this eatery - minus the dolphins...it is the same thing. A group of people are seated around a grill in which the "trainer" or chef makes noises with utensils and then flips food into mouths of the people that pay $30 each to be treated like a sea lion and clap after being tossed a piece of shrimp. 

Excitement level - crazy weird. Not my thing, I would rather head to the real Sea World and laugh at the goofy dolphins and sea lions doing tricks for food than the Vegas elite...

Decent food though...

Love this place!!!
I have eaten here several times with friends and always had excellent service and great food. I always do the hibachi and my favorite is the Steak and Shrimp. The choices are excellent and they fix it to your preference.

We came here with a crave for hibachi. We don't crave for hibachi very often but it happened to be one of those day, so we decided to give Ohjah a try. 

We came here on a Sunday 6 pm but hibachi table was all full. Have to wait at least an hour. They do not serve hibachi food if you sit at regular table. So I highly recommend making a reservation or call ahead if you're going for hibachi. 

The service was great, the manager was very friendly and polite explained to us about the wait. Our chef was also fun and engaging. We get to see lots of cool tricks as usual. 

Food was just alright. The crave for hibachi is all about that buttery garlic soy sauce fried rice! But it was kind of tasteless and missing the rich butter and garlic taste. Disappoint.. but the shrimp and filet mignon was good. I recommend adding garlic butter with your steak - Yum! 

Overall experience - not impressed. It's just what you can expect at an average hibachi restaurant. If we're craving for hibachi next time, we'll probably go for Benihana since now it's open in Vegas!

I wanted to like this place, the one time I went the food was good, price was great, and hibachi is always fun (however the service was terrible, the waitress didn't speak english, seemed miserable, and came by to refill our drinks MAYBE once.)  However, I thought it would be a neat place to have my bday and bring 7 of my friends.  The day of my bday I called and asked if I could make a reservation for 9 pm.  They told me no, the only time they could fit me in was 8 pm.  A little too early, but I make my friends rush and we get there at 8 pm on the dot.  The employee at the front was SO RUDE, said there was no way i made a reservation because he was working   the phone all day and I didn't call, and then DEMANDS to see my phone as proof that I  called and made a reservation.  After I show him my phone, he says "Was this today"... umm it clearly is timestamped saying today. Then he says "Well we have no room, you can come back at 9". WHAT?! that was the original time I wanted and you said I couldn't have!?!?  Needless to say, he totally ruined my bday!
The best Japanese and hibachi we've found in the Valley so far. Excellent for take-out, and the sushi is top notch.

We really liked this place. Nothing too fancy. The chefs were really great! We had hibachi. The salad and soup were delicious as were the vegetables, rice, and noodles. Very fast and pleasant service.

I came here with my family and my 4 year old daughter. We all had a blast and so did my daughter. The chef was hilarious and  the food was AMAZING. I got the chicken, filet, scallops, and a sushi roll which were all great. The prices aren't bad at all and they have a nice selection of sake.  Definitely coming back!

Another quality meal from the team behind Ohjah. This is my second time at the restaurant and first at this location and the meal lived up to my prior recollections. Great service, lively cook, and a fun time all around. This time I went with the NY Strip and tried some filet from the person I dined with. This is actually very quality meat considering the price. Cooked exactly how I asked (medium rare) and seasoned tremendously. I am a true fan of the Ohjah experience.  For about $20 each you can really experience a hibachi themed meal here.

Always fast service here!
The seafood yakisoba and the lasagna roll is my favorite!
For a fun date , try the hibachi grill!

Some great Hibachi! 

Went with some dear friends for a celebrated event. Service was moderate (we waited quite a bit, but we were a party of 15+). Hibachi was pretty damn fine Hibachi. Meat portions on the metal grill were scant so definitely get two upgrades.

Glorious Oddity: The Thai Curry was the best Thai Curry I've ever had. Better than Pin Kaow. It was amazing. AMAZING.

The place is an excellent value.

I like coming here for their Sashimi. I'm so used to AYCE sushi that I compare it to Ohjah. So i only come when I crave Sashimi.Yum! They have Hibachi which I don't care for so the dining area is less busy.

I really enjoyed the food here. We ate hibachi. My lobster tail was amazing! The scallops were really good too. I'm craving it now haha! Was a very good first experience. I always see this place driving blue diamond. Glad that I gave it a try. Will have to do sushi next time!

Came here for sushi last night, did not know what to really expect but to our surprise it was quite pleasant. My g/f and I split a blue diamond special, the sashimi and nigiri were good in a generic way. I suggest to get the white tiger roll it is fantastic and the spider man roll was good too. Onion soup was not hot and was kind of disappointing according to my g/f and the chicken fried rice was also so-so. Overall it was a good evening, the Sushi Chef that was serving us was super friendly and helpful.

We had a wonderful anniversary dinner at Ohjah Steakhouse. The food was very good and the service was top notch. This place is just as good or better than the other expensive Japanese Steakhouse restaurants but Ohjah is a much better value. We will be coming back here for sure. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice restaurant.

The menu has many tempting choices for you to choose from. We had the Hibachi dinner with New York steak, lobster tail, shrimp, and chicken. They were all perfectly cooked and delicious.  Next time i plan to try the sushi too. 


Also, we met some very nice people at our table which made the experience even better.

Had gone many times with my children and had pleasant experiences. Even plugged them on Facebook videos and all. However last week we decided to go a little early for dinner around four for hibachi and it was empty we were literally the only ones there we asked to sit facing the grill not on the side because my kids get excited to catch the food in there mouth. The lady seating us told us no there may be another party coming in and she would have to move us. I couldn't believe it  there was literally no one else there and even if there was that was just rude. She also took the liberty of taking my cocktail menu. I decided to leave before we ordered it was obvious they were not interested in happy customers this day at least not us. I don't think we will be patronizing them again Luckily Vegas has a lot more options.
Last night was my 2nd time there and once again the food and the atmosphere was amazing. The two chefs I've had we're phenomenal and hilarious. Would definitely recommend this to friends.

Hubby took me here for mother's day, because I love Japanese food! It was great!
No wait (tho we went at I think 9pm) we didn't do the hibachi.
Everything we ordered was great, fresh and delicious. And less expensive then we were expecting. And we got a free small sake!
Highly recommend this place, we will be coming back for sure!

Yoooo! Ohjah gets a big fat noooojah from me! I wanted to order the hibachi steak with fried rice but i was informed you can only get hibachi steak at the hibachi grill side. Fair enough, i was seated at a table so i just ordered their dinner ny steak that came with all parts of a hibachi steak minus fried rice and minus the hibachi. What my server brought out( i dont know his name but he was asian and skinny, so ill call him Chad) was this abysmal excuse of a ny steak. It was thin as hell, like it just got done fasting for 48 hrs and THEN ran a marathon. The taste was non-existant. For $17, you would expect a decent steak, lets just say that memo was not given to ohjah. The meso soup that came with it was awful. The salad that came with it was very good because of their dressing. So if you want a tasty salad, try ohjah. But If you want a good steak come to my backyard and ill whip one up on the barbie! Nooojah is a no go but Chad was the shit!:)

I really love this place, and am sad I didn't know it existed until a couple of months ago. It's got everything going for it. The ambiance is beautiful, the waitstaff is friendly and eager to please, and the food it amazing. It's also very reasonably priced for the quality of food they offer. Ever since Nagoya closed down I've been looking for a good replacement. This place is even better than Nagoya in my opinion. I haven't tried the hibachi portion of this yet, I've only sat down for dinner but I'm willing to bet it's a positive experience.
We try to go to this restaurant about every other month.  Everything is wonderful - food, service, atmosphere and the show they put on the Hibachi grill in front of you.  Keep up the good work.

Great little place in Southwest Vegas off Blue Diamond.  Great hibachi.  Think, juicy meat sauteed just perfectly.  Real good sushi rolls as well.  Can't go wrong with this place either way whether you choose hibachi, japanese entrees, or sushi.

I've been here about 5 times in the past year since I've known about this joint. I've had their chicken katsu dish and I've had their chicken teriyaki bento box that comes with gyoza, white rice, california rolls and side salad and they did not disappoint.

I like the fact that you get a good sized meal for a fair price and the staff is always friendly and attentive. I would like this place even more if they carried brown rice, but unfortunately they don't.

I highly recommend this joint If your in the area looking for a quick bite and don't want to spend more than $15 on a meal.

We tried the Hibachi Grill!

We came in on a Friday night with a party of 11 for a birthday party but they seated us in less then 5 minutes (reservations helped). All the seats at all 6 hibachi stations were maxed out.  Really impressed with how fast we got in there.  Most places even with reservations you still have to wait a little.

All of us ordered the three choice option at the grill which was a lot of food for under $32.  I did shrimp, calamari, and chicken with noodles!  Oh wee it hit the spot!

The ambience is fairly quiet until the chefs do their thing to entertain then the sound level spikes up, but that's the whole experience it's part of the fun.  My kids (8, 6, 5) haven't had a hibachi experience since they were babies so they finally got to enjoy it.

I checked in and got a free Sake!  Thank you for a great Friday Night!
Great sushi.  Though not all you can eat.  The Holy Moly appetizer is AWESOME

In my opinon this is the best Hibachi grill for the price in town. The food is always fresh and my g/f loves the cheap Sake! Enough said! I always tell everybody that they should make reservations because they are always busy. In fact I just made one just now for 7pm!

This is one of our staple restaurants. There isn't usually a wait, but it does get busy and lively. We haven't tried the hibachi yet, but are looking forward to it. 

The miso soup is good, and because I'm pregnant I haven't tried too much sushi. I did get a tempura shrimp roll once and was disappointed that the batter was soggy instead of crunchy. However, I recently had the shrimp tempura entree, and it was dynamite, so they clearly can make a mean tempura if they want. The tempura dipping sauce was a little bland. Many of their sushi specialty rolls tend to be on the hot side rather than sweet. I usually don't eat California rolls, but my husband did the other day, and it was the best CA roll I've ever had. It left me scratching my head wondering how a CA roll could be so good.

Their teriyaki is pretty good. Sometimes the chicken is dry, but the New York steak is consistently good, and tender for NY. They reportedly make their own teriyaki sauce, and do not use MSG, huge plus.

As for sides, their rice can be inconsistent, but their salads have good dressing and are pretty darn good for iceberg lettuce.

The service is decent, but there are some new servers who do things like put the food on the middle or end of the table instead of in front of the person who ordered it. Usually not a biggie, unless its hot soup they put in front of a young child...

That aside, it's one of our favorite "regular" places.
Our meals were very good. Atmosphere was a little loud to be able to have a conversation but very fun. Very good service.

I love this little local restaurant. I have been to another location and this one multiple times and have not left disappointed. They offer sushi at the sushi bar or anywhere in the restaurant and I find it to be of great value and excellent quality.  The rolls are large and filling, definitely worth grabbing if you stop in.  I also recommend the teppanyaki style dining, it is extremely affordable and is of much better quality and appeal than any of the large competitors like Benihana's or other teppan style restaurants in town. If you want to avoid the teppan, you can just grab an entree off the regular menu. We have tried many of the different options and all of them are greatly priced and extremely filling. Many times me and my wife will just split an entree and some rolls and leave their over filled with left overs. If you're ever looking for some good Japanese, I highly recommend it.

One of the top meals I've ever eaten!

Along with outstandingly fresh sushi, authentic yakisoba, perfect vegetable tempura, and melt-in-your-mouth mochi, the service there was the absolute best I've ever experienced. I don't write many reviews but felt this place needed my mentioning. 

Normally I research my restaurant options but yesterday we were starving and happened on this place so decided to chance it. 

As soon as we walked in the door the staff rushed to greet us and then got down on the kids level and talked to them for a minute. Awesome! They were also very helpful and patient with our many questions about menu items and didn't seem irritated by our indecisivness. 

We made our order and our rainbow roll was on the table within, not kidding, 3 minutes and was so SO fresh. As each dish was brought out and tasted, I was increasingly impressed. I wayyy overdid it on eating but the food was so worth it. The staff was very attentive and observant and when one of my girls started crying, they brought her over a small candy and talked to her. 

They were very polite and rushed to the door to bid us goodbye as well. 

We will be back for sure.

This place was so great! The service was amazing, food was delicious, atmosphere is fun and inviting, plus it has the best mochi I have ever eaten! We will definitely be coming back. My husband hates driving far to get good food, this place is definitely worth the drive.

As a sushi fan on a budget, this place hit the spot. Attentive but not overbearing staff turn out plates of sushi faster than you can fill your sake cup. Pages of special rolls that go beyond the typical Philly Roll and Spider Roll. 

We ordered the Bonsai Dinner which included: 

*2 Special Rolls - Thumbs up for the Widow and Kamikaze Roll (smoked salmon? heavenly.)
*TEN! pieces of Nigiri- no substitutions from the menu but the chef gave us top notch fishies
*Seaweed Salad 

Along with a large Asahi and hot sake our bill was under $60. A much better deal than the ever increasing prices of All-You-Can-Eat on every corner of this sinful city.
I like the atmosphere and their prices!! specially the 3 rolls specials for only $25. It kids friendly and very wellcoming people.

We ventured off the Vegas strip for this one. My friends kept asking me "WHERE ARE WE GOING? IT'S SO FAR." In reality - a $30 cab ride split between 4 of us was WELL worth it. 

Delicious food. Our waitress was very attentive. Our chef was hilarious, easygoing, fun, and obviously a great cook.

Definitely try the shrimp tempura roll... one of the best I've had. And for Hibachi I recommend the shrimp, any of the steaks, and the fried rice. I wasn't really a fan of the chicken though... a bit dry for my liking.

Love, love, love this place.

I give this place one star because of the food. We ordered the deluxe sashimi, The fish was not fresh n not cold. ordered beers, beers were almost at warm at my sake (seriously). Told the waitress,she changed it for us. Rt when we finish our sake, my bf said why do I have tea in my cup? the waitress was rt there when he pour the sake n a piece of brown cucumber fell out of the sake bottle, she took that bottle n ran off so fast. It was so gross I threw up! The service was great, definitely not coming back to this place.

This place is in our neighborhood and is very delcious! They have a special it's buy 2 rolls get one free! Rocky is so funny and nice he's one of the guys who creates the delicious rolls! Whenever I need a quick bite I come here!

SERIOUSLY great service. The hibachi space has adequate seating so you don't feel cramped. Plus I got free saki just for yelping.

The hostess was really nice. When I showed her my YELP check in, I think she got just as excited as I was. With the press of a button *poof* just like that free hot saki. 

The chefs are great here. They are not just entertaining but they have a certain swagger when rocking those knives and spices. The entertainment factor alone made the night cool. The food was super good. All of the other reviews are 100% accurate. Everything just melts in your mouth. I was a little hesitant about getting the shrimp because previous reviews said it tasted too fishy or something like that. Im not sure if they made some changes or what, but it tasted fine to me. The 5 star factor here are the employees. We went here to celebrate a birthday and they made it really special. It wasn't just about the song or the dessert. They made the entire experience memorable. Ohjah ill definitely be back.

I didn't get the young lady's name the last time I was here but I saw her today and had to shout her out!  Her name is Alice and she is really friendly.

I pretty much got the same thing except this time I asked for extra garlic for the fried rice and veggies.  The vegetables were cooked just right--flavorful and delicious.  

Maybe it was my driving, maybe not, but half of the rolls came apart by the time I got home but that didn't affect the taste one bit :)

If you are vegan be sure to ask for the ginger dressing with the salad.  I forgot this time and ended up with the mayo-based dressing.  

Still good service.  Didn't have to wait long.

Went in for sushi with the family. Ordered 4 rolls, the squid appetizer (can't remember the name, kushi something), and the chicken yakisoba. The rolls came out right away. The kushi took about 45 minutes, and the yakisoba over an hour. The rolls were good and so was the kushi, but unfortunately when the yakisoba finally came, I couldn't eat it, it came with the paper from a straw in it. Had it come from my straw, I would've eaten it, but I was unsure where it came from, as it didn't come from our table.  We received a discount and the dish was removed from our check, but after an hour I was really looking forward to trying it. May not be returning..
As for the service, saw waiter a few times in the hour and 45 minutes we were there, but only received one update on the length of time for the yakisoba and kushi.

The food is great but the service as usual sucks the owner stopped us Rightaway and said for us to sit at the table and did not want to let us sit at the Hamachi table because there was an enough people had one table. (There was six of us)
Sit at the sushi bar you get the best service from the chefs in the back.

How did this place receive 4 stars?? I came in on a Thursday night after work at the Blue diamond location  and the service I can say was great but was totally subpar food. I enjoyed my Sapporo bottled beer but the filet and subsequent rice and vegetables sucked!!! The dipping sauces were watery and not flavorful so I couldn't remedy my overdone medium rare filet which was medium to medium well now at best. I have reviewed many restaurants on yelp fairly- and tonite this place was horrible. I hate giving bad reviews but ohjah please do something with your hibachi grill food!!! It is marginal at best!!

This place is divided into two different Japanese restaurants, you can dine on the tappanyaki side or the regular menu side. Both are very delicious. There are so many tappanyaki restaurant and Ohjah has the best. The price is reasonable and the food is very good quality. The chefs are super fun and they definitely bring their unique tricks to grill. As for the regular menu side, it's a little more pricy but the food does not disappoint. I wish they offered All You Can Eat sushi, but they don't so getting the sushi platter or sushi boat would be the next best option. I love their sashimi and nigiri because their fish is really fresh. However, if someone your party doesn't eat sushi, they may not enjoy the selection on the regular menu and it would be more ideal to eat on the tappanyaki side of the restaurant. Lastly, I would have to say that the service is a little better on the regular menu side than the tappayaki side. It seems as though the waiters are a little slower and distracted on the tappayaki side. But on the regular menu side, I have to give two thumbs up to the waiters. Often times you order sushi at restaurants and there seems to be a language barrier or something, but here at Ohjah they usually understand what you're ordering and they rarely get orders wrong. I give the waiters a lot of credit for knowing their menu well.

Love the atmosphere, love the staff and the chef who put on an adequate show with his cooking skills in front of the patrons.

For appetizers, ordered the seaweed salad which was on par with typical sushi spots.

Ordered the $48.95 dollar sushi boat + hibachi for our main entree. Presentation of the boat was good, except the sushi tasted just a-ok, nothing special compared to other sushi places we have gone to. The sashimi wasn't bad either, but didn't rise to the top. The tuna & salmon --- just okay.

The biggest upside is the hibachi. Having the chef cook in front of you never gets old to me. The hibachi basic + add-ons were all very tasty, although we noticed the cook did add A LOT of butter when he cooked.

Overall, you should have a good time here. But if you want better tasting sushi in Las Vegas, you're better off at Oyshi, Sushi Tower or Nobu (on the strip).
Great Atmosphere, fun for families as well as couples, service and crowd pleasing performance, the steak and sushi are high quality

The food was whatever. If you don't like teriyaki make sure to tell them. The tricks were cool though and they did a couple I never saw before. If you really want to go to hibachi, it's an easy neighborhood choice.
I don't know what it is about their combination fried rice, but every time I order it, the planets seem to align and all seems right in the world.
Phenomenal food!! The sushi was amazing & so was the teriyaki beef wrapped around cream cheese with green onions!!! Yummy!!! The service was wonderful & the restaurant was so clean!!

This place lives up to the hype!!  Excellent, really fresh food.  Great service and super reasonable.  Not like the overpriced hibachi restaurants near and on the strip. My family and I will be regulars for sure!
Always busy on a Friday night. Staff is great and attentive. Food is really healthy and fresh will go back again.

The sushi and service are consistently very good.

I always order the rainbow roll when I get sushi - for two reasons: it's my favorite and it allows me to compares restaurants. Their rainbow roll ranks well.

They just need a happy hour, or at least specials on Sake!
This used to be my favorite restaurant. Still pretty good but I miss there lunch time specials.
Soo good and great laid back atmosphere.

The entire staff was very pleasant and friendly. Food was amazingly delicious! I loved the pomegranate sake, just yummy. Not only did our waitress check back with us more than once, but the waiter and manager did as well. The lighting was great, music was at perfect level, and they were even showing The World Cup on TV. I am impressed with the entire experience. I highly recommend them. People that know me, know I am not one to give 5 stars, be today, it was well deserved!
Nice place clean and my favorite Sushi Chef Larry now works here Yah! So happy they have a huge menu.

We couldn't even eat here.... I mean really!! The guy at the front said that since we didn't make reservations we couldn't eat there. Maybe we didn't understand his broken English..... He said "to eat you need reservation"..... I didn't know I was going to be off work tonight.... It was a spur of the moment date night with the husband.... And we were refused service!!!! I won't be going back!!
awesome food and CHEF! there are local spots that a tourist must try in las vegas... and this is one of them! great and entertaining chef :)

Didn't get five because we come here weekly but it doesn't feel like we are appreciated!

The food is great and service pretty good.

The poke is what we get every time but now it's less and less poke!

They need to treat repeated customers better

Went here Feb 27th, 2016. It was awesome. My mom was out for a visit from Ohio and want to take my niece and I out for dinner. They have great prices, great service, & great entertainment. Food was so good. I will be back.
This is our third time here. So far so good. Food is fresh.  well-prepared. quality is very good. price is average for sushi.  Service was excellent.

Food was awesome!  All five of our kids (2-12) loved it.  We ate in the dinning room this time and had sushi, chicken teriyaki, curry, edamame, mussels.  Everything was amazing. Our third visit to this location and we will definitely be back.
Best locals hibachi place Ive been to in vegas. Great prices service and food.
Want great sushi? Eat here. The presentation and service are great and their prices are reasonable. I love this place!

The garlic edamame is my favorite here than the rest of the restaurants in Vegas.  The crazy jalapeno is delicious.  This are my top 2 dishes here.  I like the choices in wine and the yelp free sake is great to have.  The option of hibachi, sushi, or both is terrific.  Come try this location or any of the other Ohjah properties

I'm not sure why the reviews are so high of this place, it's pricey and the sushi was mediocre at best. I had the special sushi dinner which was 3 choices of special sushi for $25.95. We also had the chicken teriyaki it's was OK as well. It just wasn't that good, we won't be back.

My boyfriend and I came out to Las Vegas for fun. I searched for hibachi grill and this was one of the first to pop up. We had to drive a little ways since we were staying at Treasure Island but it was definitely worth it. The sushi was very decently priced and yummy. Our hibachi cook was very good. The filet mignon was so juicy, tender and flavorful. I thoroughly enjoyed this place and highly recommend it. :) Would love to go back again.

This is our third time here but first time trying their teppanyaki. The a la carte menu has pretty good items including sushi rolls. Before tonight this was just a safe place to try decent Japanese near our home. Having the teppanyaki was the best decision! The cook also puts on a show, like the flaming onion ring volcano plus he launches shrimp from the grill into the patrons mouths. Now on to the food... we got the sukiyaki beef and NY steak (both prepared medium) as well as scallops, shrimp and salmon. For group of five, we just got 2 orders each of the above to share and it proved plenty. Totally loved everything we were served! I finished it all but the rest of the family had to get take out boxes. Also included were a cup of onion soup, salad with ginger dressing and grilled vegetables, which was also pretty good. The service is excellent! We'll definitely be back.

First time here tonight and everything was so wonderful. Came as a party of 8 and didn't know what to expect. I was confused to how to order at first but the waitress explained how the habachi worked.

The chef we had that cooked our food was hilarious and joked with me a lot. 

Food was just delicious. And the service we got from all the staff was amazing. I believe the manager even came around to see if everyone was happy and doing good.

They even brought out a cake for the birthday girl that was with us.

One of my favorite sushi restaurants! The food is great, prices are fair and the service is always on.

Chef David at the sushi bar is amazing! He is very creative and always has a smile. The sushi is always fresh and never disappoints. They have Sapporo and Kirin on tap, which is a nice compliment to the fresh sushi. They also have a habachi room that puts on a great show, fills you up and is very reasonably priced (the fried rice in there is awesome!).

Order the sushi boat! its amazing! really filled us up! the hostess was really great as well, she kept checking up on us and was really nice. 

we first had a small table, and when a slightly bigger table opened up, they we able to move us to accomodate as we wanted some elbow room which was good :)

im very picky on my sushi places, so this place gives the thumbs up to me!

I LOVE the food here, especially the buttery fried rice at the hibachi grill.  Everything I've had there is good and service is good.  Though I would like to give them 5 stars, I'm giving only 2 because they were shut down by the health department and featured on channel 13 news Dirty Dining recently.  I'm going to wait until I'm not grossed out anymore before I go back.  But I'm guessing I will be back.
Best Japanese Steakhouse in town! Prices are fair, service is excellent.
bomb..bomb.. .always great food, funny chefs, one of my favorite spots..i always get 3 item filet, shimp, and scallops..yumm..
We come here every week and never disappointed with the quality and service.  I also like the flexibility from the chef, always willing to make anything you want.  Check it out, great sushi!!!

I really enjoyed this place. Its very typical of what i expect from a Japanese Steakhouse and Hibachi room. They also had sushi and a limited thai menu making it great for a large group with varying tastes. They didnt do Hibachi at the normal tables which I found a bit shortsided. Many friends like Hibachi but they dont like the smell their clothes take on. Overall, the service was very on point, prices were very reasonable, food quality was very good. The filet I had was good, but not the highest quality. The chef cooking was alot of fun. Had a few new tricks I haven't seen. Another must visit destination.

Dynamite roll is just that-dynamite!
The Sushi was off the charts delicious and the service was terrific also.
I was also happy to see that Hibachi dining was available which is always a plus when you've got kids (I don't, but my friends do).
I've been here twice-once at the Sushi Bar and once at the Hibachi table; both offered great food, good service and a reason to come back.

I can only speak for the hibachi side. I LOVED IT. We each ordered the combination with filet mignon, shrimp, scallop and calamari. My boyfriend had the fried rice and I had the fried noodle (chow mein).  I would just like to say it was so delicious and melts on your mouth!  We loved our chef and our food, but whilst eating dinner a check gets dropped off then 5 minutes later the manager checked if we paid.

 Although I understand that maybe as hibachi tables stand, there's another group of people coming in, we still felt rushed and needed to get out. We were there to celebrate and to drink with really great food, but we were cut short. I hate feeling like we're being rushed out, especially when dessert wasn't offered. Because we felt like we needed to clear out, we didn't even get to look at the dessert menu again, and I wanted dessert! I mean, we were celebrating. We would've ordered another round of drinks with dessert, but wasn't given the chance and that is the only complaint.

Note: Can't comment on the hibachi because we did not choose that option.

Came here for a dinner with the family as a first-timer and I was pleasantly surprised. The food is great. I recommend trying the Holy Moly and Gyu-Ishiyaki for starters.

Service was great as well. We were served by a really nice young lady (I forgot her name, sorry) who was extremely polite.

A great place to try if you're undecided on a Japanese restaurant. :)
I have eaten here on multiple occasions always Hibachi which is awesome and great fun as well.

Went with my colleagues (8 people) around 5PM and was seated right away. It took some time for the chef to show up but we didn't mind since we had our drinks and the free sake after checking in Yelp. I had the New York steak hibachi which was ok. Service was great but their sake menu was very limited. 

Bottom line: great service, inexpensive, average food and limited sake options.

My husband and I decided to check out Oojah the other night for a late lunch/early dinner. I loved the decor of the restaurant. Very nice looking! The staff was all very friendly and accommodating as well. 

We made it in time to enjoy their lunch box specials, which were smaller and cheaper versions of their dinner boxes. I got the chicken katsu box while my husband got the beef teriyaki box. I couldn't believe the size of the boxes when they were brought to our table! Not only was my portion of the chicken katsu huge, but it also came with miso soup, salad, pork dumplings, and three California rolls (perfect because I am pregnant and can't have traditional sushi). The food was great and very filling! 

I felt the prices were fair for what we ordered and even looking at the menu, the sushi prices I felt were reasonable as well. 

We'll definitely be visiting Oojah again and I can't wait until I am able to try out their sushi!

Nice show,but I like my food to all come at once.I didn't like that the vegtables came out way before the meat was cooked??I think this type of food should all be cooked at the same time.The meat and vegtables were good,but the portions were small.
  I think with a few upgrades this could be 5 stars.

Overall, great food! I ordered the chicken teriyaki, and yes I have had it before, but not prepared the way it's done here. My dad ordered the chicken fried rice and raved about it all night. Again, great food, and I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone looking for great sushi and great Japanese food.

Had another wonderful dinner with great friendly service. Will be coming back to try out some of their other delicious baked sushi next time!

This was the best Japanese restaurant we ever ate.
Our waitress  was the most wonderful

The sushi rolls here are to die for, so elegantly decorated and every bite wants to you to have more. I thought cream cheese in the middle was a bit odd but now "Dark Cycle" is my favorite roll. The ambiance was great and they had a large TV to watch last nights NBA game which was nice. The reason why I'm giving a 4 star is b/c of the service. Our waitress had to be called over four times to get more water, the check, etc. We even had to get a different guy to get some of those things. I would definitely come back with my handy groupon.

Oh man...great teppanyaki and at a great price! I came for dinner for Father's Day and tried out the teppanyaki. I love how they do their offerings. They separate the meats by section and individual price so that you can mix and match your plate however you want. I chose the NY strip steak and the shrimp. My sister tried the scallops and NY steak. MY father tried the sukiyaki beef and NY steak, and my brother in law tried the Salmon and chicken. 

You start with the $8.95 basics which includes the the option of fried rice, steamed rice, or noodles, soup, and salad. This is MANDATORY for teppanyaki. Then you pick from the list of meats you'd like and you just mix and match. They also offer kobe beef at $50 and lobster tail also at $15. The dishes and offerings are typically what you'd expect for teppanyaki. Same quality and flavor. Next time I would love to try the filet minon instead as I wasn't too fond of the NY strip steak. It was tougher and less flavoring. The sukiyaki beef is A GOOD CHOICE. They're full of flavor, tender, and juicy! 

Our chef was great, He was funny, and very patient with obnoxious children. So big ups to him. For a total of 4 people plus an order of a glass of reisling and tempura ice cream we spent a good $100.00. Woohoo! What a deal! That's compared to my tab at Musashi which was $160.00 for 2 people! Same quality of food. Same service. Cheaper price. Call me a fan! I'll be back soon!
Really good sushi great presentation came in a boat great family atmosphere 3 rolls for $25 so it's not quite all you can eat but still got filled up for under $100 family of 4

First time coming here, my mom recommended this spot. Sushi was served really quick, Danny made me a special roll.

I gave them 4 stars just because the rolls are super tiny, they are still good tho.

The last time we ate at Ojhah in Las Vegas was in 2014.  They impressed us so much that we came to try their Hibachi this time.  TIP:  Apparently you need reservations for the Hibachi.  We didn't have any so we had to wait 30 minutes.  Luckily there is a drug store next door you can pass the time in.  We were seated with a lovely family of 6.  All together there were 4 kids under 10 years old, our 2 teens (14 & 16 years old) and 4 parents.  The other Hibachi got the more enthusiastic chef.  Ours was just meh.  The fried rice made via Hibachi is always good but the meat (chicken) was kind of dry and tasteless.  I guess that's why they give you sauce.  What they did not give me was my free sake for checking in via Yelp.  I did order a salmon skin hand roll which was excellent.  I think they do better with their sushi than their Hibachi.  I'd probably return for their sushi, but I was not at all impressed with the Hibachi.

The rolls we ordered were cold and the sushi was small . The rice was really sticky. It was a little on the high side when it came to the price,the sauce in the rolls was too sweet.  The waitress was hard to communicate with but she was nice. I don't think I will becoming back here again there are other sushi joints in the area that are better when it comes to food service & prices.

The service was the worst we have had iin years. My wife and I ate there tonite. We live near by and have been waiting for it to open.  We were seated right away. The waitress got our drinks took our order for an appetizer that came in 10 minutes. We then ordered a 3 roll  sushi special. That took 25 minutes to come. Way to long. We never were asked if we needed a refill on are drinks even when mine was empty. Then it took 20 minutes just to get the waitresses attention to get the check. After she brings the check she says do want a refill. ( ya right after I'm done eating) I said no that might take another 20 min. It took us an 1 hour and 20 minutes to get out of there on a single order. We will never go there again. Oh, and the people at the next table complained the the manager to. He gave them a free desert wow. Food was good but not worth the bad service and long wait time. We were there at 6pm
The food was pretty good and very reasonably priced. We had a couple sushi rolls with some chicken curry. Everything was solid and I'll be going back for sure.

I wasn't so excited to go to this restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised!  Everything was very clean and fresh. I am picky and I was able to trust the chef. He cooked everything perfect and flavored to my liking without my making any special requests.  The service was excellent!  I have never been in and out of teppanyaki so fast! I was hungry, and I was fed!  I've been going to the same teppan restaurants for years, I think I have a new favorite =)

Not a good experience tonight. Usually everything is great but tonight was pretty bad. We took our friends and their 11-year-old son for the first time to experience the restaurant.  Our chef was very nice but was boring. He did the volcano trick and the eggroll trick but that was it. Our friends son was really looking forward to the shrimp tossing but we never got it. Also, my husband ordered the Seabass and it was absolutely disgusting!!! It was a very bad piece of fish that smelled AWFUL!!!! He didn't eat it. And when we let the chef know, he said he would let the manager know. But then we had a remind the waitress, who came back and took it off the bill. But he was never asked if he was still hungry or wanted anything else. They brought out the check and were never offered dessert. Looking forward to the Pecos and windmill restaurant opening up. We'll be back, because we've always had a good time here.
Service was good, our rolls came out extremely quickly. The rolls had too much rice for my taste but it was decent 3/5 stars.

Ohjah is the type of place you feel compelled to open a Yelp account for just to tell people how much you love it. 

By far the best hibachi in town. The prices are right, the service and cooks are awesome - genuinely nice people there. 

On a couple occasions if we found ourselves waiting for a bit for a few other people to join our cooking area, they've offered a free appetizer or a free drink. Not sure if that is official policy but it definitely was nice. 

The food is amazing. My girlfriend regularly gets the Salmon. I get Lobster and Filet.

Only have had a couple of the sushi rolls, mainly go there for hibachi, but they were great!

Always a fun atmosphere, always someone's birthday. 

If they could fix ANYTHING it would be to get a better birthday song for their iPod. Man. It's bad. And you'll hear it 1-5 times during your visit. 

Beyond that, excellent place. Absolutely try it.

We come here at least once a month to once every couple of months. We especially enjoy eating at the Hibachi side and we always, always request for VAN when we make reservations here. 

Since Ohjah first opened here, we've had many other chefs. My whole family agrees that Van has been our best chef there. 

For take out days, we love ordering their sushi rolls specials which is 3 orders of rolls for about $25. Such a great deal and all the rolls we've had here so far have been delicious.

Great Hibachi and Pad Thai! Staff is friendly, nice, and quick.  Great neighborhood atmosphere.  Live hibachi style seating or just sit in the front for a quick bite.  Food is always fresh and delicious.  I completely recommend this little hideaway.  It has become one of our favorite places to eat.  Thank you!

Weeks of enduring the heavenly aromas of teriyaki goodness sizzling away on hearty grills, wafting across the road every time I drove by this restaurant, are what brought me to Ohjah.

As the restaurant was being built, and when it finally opened, I remember thinking (with a raised eyebrow), "Another restaurant in a strip mall... hmm."  I'm very glad for the overly enticing smells coming from this place, otherwise, I may not have found one of my new favorite restaurants, and a true hidden gem.

Let me just say, right off the bat, that a prerequisite for working at this restaurant is to be one of the most genuinely nice and polite people on the face of the earth; I have never seen such friendly service... EVER.  We are greeted promptly and warmly every time we dine here.  The servers are always very attentive, and extra dishes are removed right away.

The restaurant is divided into two sections: the hibachi grill side, and the regular restaurant side (which includes a large sushi bar, booths, and tables).  Although I have only ever eaten on the regular restaurant side, I must say I will definitely try the hibachi side one day because of the sounds, smells, and action coming from that room are incredible! 

The food is also incredible.  Some of the items we have had are: teriyaki scallops, tempura (vegetables and shrimp), numerous sushi rolls (the Black Widow is amazing!), nigiri, sashimi, miso soup, and the house salad.  All were equally delicious (and I'm finding myself strangely addicted to the house salad dressing -- it is mayo based and surprisingly light).  I did find the teriyaki scallops to have a bit too much of the "char" bits on them, but other than that, they were cooked perfectly, and the sauce complimented the flavor of the scallops very well.  The food is always fresh and delivered in a timely manner, and the plating is intricate, balanced, and inviting.  The prices are affordably appropriate as well.

I read in another review that this restaurant would be a great "first date" place to go, and I wholeheartedly agree (for the hibachi or the regular restaurant side).  The ambiance is very pleasant with simple and beautiful artwork on the walls, and low lighting, giving it a romantic feel.  At the same time, it is definitely a very family-friendly restaurant, and a great place to come with friends (especially with $2.50 sake bombs!).

Definitely give this restaurant a try when in Vegas, you won't be disappointed.  And if you live here in Vegas, and don't live close to this particular location, there are a few other locations in town (I have been to the Flamingo location recently, and if I were to review it, I would literally copy and paste this review in for that one as well).

This is our favorite Japanese Hibachi Grill and Restaurant in Vegas. We found it by accident a few years ago and come here for lunch or dinner every time we are in town. They never disappoint. Today was the first time we couldn't get seating at the grill without waiting an hour so we decided to stay and try the regular menu. Again, they didn't disappoint. The waitress kept apologize for the wait (they got slammed all at once) but it really didn't feel like a long wait. We had the chicken teriyaki and filet minion teriyaki.  Absolutely delicious!!

Been to the hibachi twice, so I can't comment on the sushi bar. 
The service is great and the food is even better. Try the scallops, they are excellent.

If you enjoy tepan grills this place is worth checking out. Food is always delicious and servers always entertain, regardless of age. Their sushi is fresh and tasty. There are certain rolls I love (like the Blue Diamond Roll, YUM!) and others I'm not particularly a fan of, but that's more a matter of taste rather than quality. The tepanyaki is delicious. I've had the chicken, steak, and shrimp with fried rice --- SO GOOD! I also appreciate that when I come here with a group of friends or just my boyfriend they'll allow me to sit at the grill if I only wish to order sushi. Granted, most of my visits have been during their slower times but I still very much appreciate that they offer it. My only complaint is that every time I visit, slow or busy, I have a very difficult time getting a second refill from my server. This only really bothers me because I can be with one or two others who get three or four refills and I will have to flag them down to ask for one. Nonetheless I always come back because their prices are really competitive and the food is phenomenal.

PROS:
-I haven't been to the steakhouse side, but I heard its super awesome!
-Efficient & nice service :)
-Great sashimi
-I love how they options in their menu that saids "chefs choice" because we don't need to stress about ordering certain food

FOOD 5/5:
-Blue Diamond Dinner Special ($23.95): 2 special rolls + 8 pieces of sashimi & nigiri
-Blue Diamond Roll: shrimp tempura, crab, avocado & sliced lemon on top = amazing!
-Yellowtail nigiri: Personal favorite. I love how juicy & thick the fish slices were
-Tuna nigiri: BOMB
-Salmon nigiri: BOMB

I can't wait to come back and try more food options :)
Such good service they are amazing!! Food is delicious especially the hibachi!!! If you are around this area come and eat some delicious food!

Too good, plain and simple.  I've been going to Benihana for as long as I can remember and Ohjah is right up there with the big boys without the high ticket price tag.  The hibachi is freaking awesome, not to mention they have great sushi deals too...must try "The Boat", still haven't gotten a chance but it is a sushi display of pure beauty.  The service is always so friendly and quick, they always make sure you have what you need and they encourage that you check-in for your free house sake.  I absolutely love that Ohjah opened up five minutes away from where I live and that I don't need to get dressed to the nines to go there.  Love it!

I'm not one for giving 1 star but I have to say today my family and I came in for my wife and brother in-law birthdays. Our server was Alice, and I have to say I have never felt so disrespected the way she was speaking to my family. She had the worst attitude she made us feel like we were dumb. This is the second time we have been to this location so we were very familiar how to order but she felt otherwise. We requested for a manager and he was very cool and came back to check on us and refilled our drinks. If you visit this location and you get Alice make sure you know how to order off the menu or you might get laughed at. We won't be back! OHJAH make sure Alice takes a crash course on customer service.

Great food, great service.  

The staff is fantastic -- they remember you and what you like.  I've come to the point where I usually dont even bother looking at the menu.  I just tell them "Surprise me"

Although it does not look "kid friendly," they are extremely so.  We bring our 3 year old and 1 year old in all the time, and the kids destroy the place (sorry!).  They are always accommodating and friendly about it, and I can say that I would not have such patience if I were them.  

Of course, we also go here for business lunches all the time -- this is my place of choice for business lunches.

this place is the absolute worst. me and my friend wen there, shes from fort lauderdale fl and i decided i would take her somewhere nice but inexpensive since i've been there before and it was okay... but after tonight i will never step feet int hat place again. first the chef was sloppy, unhappy, and catch an attitude with the lady that was sitting across from us because the waitress forgot one of the fried rice she ordered so she brought it to his attention(the chef) and he said "i have nothing to do with that, ask her for another one". the chef didnt make it fun while all the other hibachi tables was excited and making noises we were the most quite table ever. so then after he cooked the fried rice which wasnt good, it was mushy(since when are fried rice mushy?) no seasoning what so ever, to make it worst, i found freaking multiple pieces of tissue cooked in to my rice"SO DISGUSTING" like i was literally chewing paper, gross! i brought it to the chef attention and he didnt even apologize, he walked away and got the manager(a male) and guess what he said "its from my straw, sure because i am a 3 year old baby who would take paper from a straw and mixed it in to my rice then try to eat it, are you kidding me? he didn't even offer to do anything about it so we just asked for the check and i attempted to search the rice again, guess what? more paper. when the lady brought the check, i said "do you still think i put straw paper in there (showing her other pieces of napkin) lol this is funny, she said "ITS JUST PAPER, ITS OKAY" i guess shes used to eating paper at home so i basically payed for food that i didnt not eat.... never again.

The hardest thing to achieve in a restaurant is consistency.  Often we go somewhere and LOVE it, then the next time its blah.  Not the case with Ohjah!  We go there about every 2 weeks and its ALWAYS AWESOME.   Sometimes the company is better than others,  some chefs are more skilled with the knives than others, but the FOOD is Always PERFECT.   You won't hear me say that too often, so trust me when I do. 
The pricing of the menu is more competitive than other Japanese steak houses.  Its $8,95 base price for the rice veggies and soup, then you ad your meats.  We usually have the Filet Mignon plus either shrimp, scallops, chicken or halibut.  The filet is like meat flavored butter, melts in your mouth.   Actually I wish they used a little more butter in the prep, but its always flavorful and healthy. 

We do usually get a tuna sashimi but I will say this.  the fish is fresh and yummy, BUT its cut in too large of chunks.  I prefer a smaller cut for a more delicate taste and feel.  We ate at the sushi bar once and all the fish was cut too large. 

Nevertheless,  the The steakhouse, hibachi grill is the BEST in town for the BEST price.  I highly recommend it any day.
great food. great prices. great ambiance. away from the las vegas strip congestion!

Giant sushi boat! It was wayyy too much food for 2 people. The 3 rolls (dynamite-sort and 2 simpler options) were great, sea weed salad was delish, but sashimi was not fresh and wayyy too thickly cut. Nice, attentive service.

Happily surprised! Clean, and nice set up! We did not eat on hibachi side, rather ordered off the menu. We had for appetizer the lasagna and Cali rolls, tempura dinner, chicken teriyaki dinner. Dinners came with miso soup and salad. Food was nice serving and try even had brown rice at not extra charge (nice)!   We will def come back! I got a gift card after for my parents....

I have been here several times for hibachi dinner and I can tell you that your dining experience here will depend on which chef perform/cook your meal. One chef will give you a 5 stars experience while the other one will make you question yourself for why the hell you're spending a lot of money for a lousy meal.

My regular and favorite chef is the tall skinny (Viet) chef who always does an excellent job entertaining guests and also make a good meal. When you go to a hibachi dinner, you expect entertainment in addition to good food. As for the other chef who cooked one of my meals, granted he was very nice, he basically just focused on cooking the food and not very entertaining at all. Even worse, the food was salty and just overall not good.

Since you are sharing the hibachi cooking table with other guests, I'm not sure if you can choose which chef will cook your dinner. Due to this reason, I am now less likely to take my guests here for dinner, which is too bad since this experience is unique and could be a lot of fun compared to strip buffet.

If you plan to come here for hibachi dinner, make sure you understand the rule of roulette. Your dining experience could land on red or black, and sometimes green :-)

Left another sushi bar not far away. Had some of the best sushi ever. The chef is a master. The food is phenomenal. Had The freshest largest Uni I've ever seen. Great food both in the Hibachi grill and now at the sushi bar. I have never gone to the same restaurant twice in 1 trip. Awesome place. Don't bother going anywhere else in Vegas.

This was the best meal I've had in a while and we eat out a lot!! The food was amazing!! The service was great! All around we were greatly entertained!!

First of we opted for the Hibachi and I am so glad we did! My fiancé loves sashimi so he ordered the blue fin tuna, I do not really care for the raw stuff only in Miami and LA did I actually enjoy it!! Well I am addicted, that blue fin tuna was so so yummy. He ended up ordering another. For six dollars you get two healthy servings and it melted in my mouth with deliciousness! I am sold that is something  that  I will order again and again!
My fiancé got the trio Hibachi he chose the filet, the scallops and sole!! I ordered the lobster tail. The star for both of us was the sole! It was all delicious but we are still dreaming about that sole!! The filet was yummy and so were the scallops and the lobster but that sole was so memorable and unexpected because I love lobster but the sole was so freaking amazing! By the way my fiancé thought the lobster was awesome, too!
I was not in the mood for sake bombs but my girlfriend that was with us never had one so we decided to get some beer and sake to have sake bombs but the Hibachi chef told us they offer  sake bomb individually which is perfect! Well after the first round we got about 4 more rounds! It was so entertaining the way they do it! We had a blast! The noodles, the soup, the rice, the veggies all so delicious and tasty I had to control myself. Jack was our Hibachi chef and was awesome!! They made us feel so welcomed. My fiancé can chug like no other so they kept giving bigger glasses of beer to try to beat him in the sake bomb challenge, they failed!! Super super night definitely be back again and again! I have already recommended this place to so many! I am so glad to have this place so close to my home Southern Highlands. We like to stay close and anything like that is xtreme sushi! We never feel comfortable and welcomed there and they have some good but a lot mediocre. So this will be our regular spot hope they stay because they are so great and in this economy where people are usually staying home it helps if you treat people right, plus I'd be heart broken if the service was bad because the food was so outstanding!! The whole combo works hope they keep it up and last!

Not your authentic japanese food. Shrimp tempura crunch roll...not fresh and not good. Veggie fried rice was bland....who ever had the bright idea of throwing bean sprouts in them??? A bit too overpowering. Never order it again!!! Korean kalbee...very fatty. Service was fast but not attentive.  If I come back, which is slim to none...I think their hibachi food is what their known for.

I live close to this place and have been there a couple times now. The food is just ok. The service is terrible!!!! Some of the worst service I have ever encountered in Las Vegas. The employees are clueless. Even the manager seems like he doesn't even know what his doing. I will never go here again and don't recommend anyone to do so if you want to have a pleasant lunch/dinner.

So delicious and amazing prices! Half the price of Geisha House.
The music is extremely soothing. Love the place and will go back often.

Unexpected dinner with out of town family, and I was very impressed with quality of food. We had two 'real' sushi eaters and two 'just need to be cooked' sushi eaters, and everyone was happy with their selections. Good service too, despite being busy, waitress always checked on us.

I highly recommend that you pick the restaurant instead of the tepankayi where they put on a show and cook infront of you. The quality ofmthe food on the restaurant side is amazing and very delicious. The other side , on other note, tasted like it was smothered with MSG. You pay for the entertainment thats why it's so expensive. The servers were very nice except for the manager. It was the third time I ate there and it was a little busy than usual. I saw the manager cussing and giving attitude at the servers and COSTUMERS! He was so unprofessional! Other than that, food is great!

Great affordable hibachi for locals. I've been to Ohjah several times and thoroughly enjoy this place!

The grillmasters are entertaining as always (I still can never catch the shrimps in my mouth for the life of me) and the service hasn't disappointed yet. 

I have tried the filet mignon, Sukiyaki beef, salmon teriyaki, and the scallops. The filet mignon is my absolute favorite, it MELTS in your mouth. Filet would definitely be my recommendation for first timers and meat lovers.

The portions are filling as with your main hibachi dish you also receive: onion soup (I request for miso soup instead), house salad, grilled veggies, and your choice of fried rice or noodles.

For those who live southwest or nearby, I definitely recommend trying out Ohjah if you're in the mood for hibachi!

I've been to several tepinyaki places and there is nothing that stands out about this place so much. Everything is al a carte which kinda threw me off at first, but actually it works out for me. I don't eat the veggies and soup so I'm just interested in the fried rice and meat. It was good, but not the best I've had. The service was great though.
Great place I gotta remember that when we come to Vegas we always make a stop here five star ...love it....
Very yummy and affordable !! The food and service was great !! Tons of great items to choose from . Will definitely be back!!
Love love love this place! My new go to when I hit Vegas. These sushi bar sheds are awesome!

I went here with my family (party of 11) for my birthday dinner and I am really glad that we opted to go here. Everything about this place was perfect, from the ambience and service to the food itself. Definitely try the Hibachi combo if you're going here, it's a really good value for the quality and quantity of food that you receive. On top of that, the hibachi chef was incredibly talented and passionate about what he was doing. We arrived late for our reservation (sorry :( ) but the waiter was very understanding about it and didn't even rush us even with another reservation for our table only an hour from the time we arrived. Overall, it was a great experience and I will be back next time I visit Vegas! 100% recommended.

Ohjah is the perfect sushi spot for us in the southwest. They have a great selection of rolls and lots of options for those who prefer their meals fish free. The main dining room is always fairly quiet and dark which sets up for a nice little romantic dinner. I prefer to go a little bit later to miss the crowd. We haven't had their hibachi yet but we have been dying to try because every time we're there, it sounds like they're having a great time!

A bunch of bad ass including me go to this Ohjah restaurant, we sit at sushi bar , and we order 3 Ohjah boat for each person , I gonna tell you this is the best fucking sushi in Vegas, you can order the chef special only for you man, the chef got good skill to create some special for yourself, and after that we order sake boom , drink about 5 round , high to  die,  and this Ohjah have 4 different location, and you want eat some best sushi and fantastic hibachi I think you should  come here check out.

I love this place! We live close by decided to stop in and wow in looks small but it is really big! Sushi bar, private booths, and a hibachi dining area. I am always iffy when it comes to sushi and the quality but this place is outstanding! The hibachi style dining is delicious and GREAT prices! The filet was so tender! You cant beat the prices here and you will always leave full and satisfied! Probably my top 3 fav restaurants in Vegas!

Ok so I've been to some prrrreeeeeetttttyy good Hibachi grills but this one was by far the best. This place was amazing and the food and service was great. My favorite thing here is the hibachi and sushi. The interaction with the chefs were amazing as well. I loved this place and I'm glad we went for my birthday. It was a blast.

I don't think of hibachi places as big draws, especially for the foodie crowd. So, I was surprised to walk into Ohjah on a Friday night and see the place packed. It's also a sushi joint, but that side of the restaurant had a few open tables. The hibachi side was filled. That's impressive considering they had six cooking stations.

The basic hibachi dinner ($8.95) consists of standard fare -- vegetables, salad, soup, and fried or steamed rice or noodles. I added shrimp ($5.75) and a 5 oz. filet ($7.55) to the mix. The shrimp was pretty good and the filet was cooked medium rare, as ordered, and was tender, as expected.

The best way to judge any hibachi place, though, is the entertainment factor. Our chef -- an older guy -- was ok. He was friendly enough, but all the tricks he did were the same standard ones you see at any hibachi place -- tossing the egg shell in the hat, the onion volcano, etc. He also tossed shrimp to some of the guests (again, a standard hibachi trick) but only to the guys, which disappointed some of the women at the table.

If you like hibachi places, you'll like this. If you don't, you probably won't be a fan. While it's similar to many others I've been to, I'd recommend this place for a fun night out whether or not it's with a date or a family.
Great little place. Sushi is fresh and delicious. Love the Hibachi room. Fun atmosphere for the family. Well priced for a Japanese restaurant.

I had heard a lot of good things about Ohjah an wanted to try it for my birthday. We had made an appointment for a regular table but changed it to the hibachi when we got there. They were nice and were able to fit us into a table.  

The chef we got was really good at cooking, but he had ZERO interaction with our table at all. He went through the motions and while it was all very impressive, he never smiled or laughed or acknowledged us. It was a bit strange.  

The food was delicious!  We shared the Hibachi combo, with one basic to share, and it was the perfect amount. The scallops were cooked perfectly, as was the steak and shrimp.  I really wanted the oysters on the half shell or oyster shooters, but they didn't have any so ended up getting a "screaming orgasm" and that was okay. It was a very small portion compared to other places. 

When most everyone at our table was done eating, the servers seemed in a rush to get us out, but we wanted to linger and try some dessert and drink more wine. It was a bit uncomfortable. They kept bringing our check and we kept asking for more things so they'd have to take it back. We were the only ones left at the table and I felt bad - I wanted to ask if we could move to a normal table since we weren't ready to leave yet, but the server told us we were fine, even though they kept bringing us our check lol.  

All in all, the food was great, the service was fast, and it was a great birthday dinner.

I come here often for the Snow White sushi roll and garlic edamame.  I have also been on the hibachi side, and had the calamari, which was excellent.,  The food and price are very reasonable. Usually not a long wait for dining in, if any.  The only trouble I have ever had is when I order by phone for take out, there have been a couple times I called 20 minutes prior to arriving, and still had to wait another 15, even though they said it would be ready in 15 minutes from the time I called.  Not sure where the issue lies with that one.  Still, they are apologetic through the waiting process, but it has happened more than once.  On the other hand, no complaints about dining in.

We love this place!!! We are always greeted with friendly amazing customer service. The seating times are structured to ensure your group or even just yourself is promptly taken care of. The quality of the food matches it's service. Great place to take relatives visiting or to celebrate birthdays !! We love Fiona!!

Very friendly service and management. Hibachi is ok, but sushi was great. Prices are very reasonable. $9 for the hibachi add-ons and from there you choose the meat (filet was an additional 8.5 so it would be 17.5 for filet).
AMAZING!!!  Went with friends and the kids and my girlfriend couldn't get enough!!  Will DEFINITELY be back next time in Vegas!!

Great food good ambiance. Will definitely be back when I'm craving habachi & sushi rolls!!! I had the Blue Diamond sushi combo my husband had the hibachi combo with steak, scallop & shrimp. Our friends had Kobe beef and everything was great but $48 on top of the $8.95 is pretty stiff especially when the Kobe was such a thin slice! All n all it was pretty good!
Glad we tried this place, and it's right in our 'hood! Calamari tempura and filet mignon hibachi we're excellent!

Luckily we made reservations as the hibachi side was packed. We enjoyed the free check in item. I appreciated the ample staff and their service. Our chef wasn't as animated as some of my previous hibachi experiences but he was on point. The lobster was very good and the filet was perfectly cooked and very tasty. One of my kids decided against hibachi and there was plenty on the menu for her to choose. I would recommend them and will return.

This place is pretty new in our area.  It's pretty wicked to have a Japanese spot with in walking distance from our house.  I watched this place being built and couldn't wait for the day the doors were open.  My wife and I finally went here for dinner when we had a visitor from Cali.  I would like to think of myself as a sushi purist and typically I don't consider eating hibachi.  Call me stuck up but, I always felt that hibachi was a bit "touristy" and more like Japanese for the "newbie".  

Anyhow, this visit made me cheat on my first love, sushi.  I loved this place and the prices were super competitive.  We started with sake bombs that were only $2, cheap!
